Class FinalGA

extends java.lang.Object
    Core module for GA functionality

    JoshMerritt

    • Constructor Detail

      • FinalGA

        public FinalGA(WindFarmLayoutEvaluator evaluator,
               java.lang.String settingsName,
               int seed)
        Initialise the GA with settings file, constraints, and random seed. Check if alternate mode is enabled. Begins run by initialising populations before running the GA
        Parameters:
        evaluator -
        settingsName -
        seed -

    • Method Detail

      • initPops

        public void initPops()
        Initialise population by creating required number of layouts. Populates 'Population' and evaluates starting fitness values.

      • runGA

        public void runGA()
        Method to run the GA. For each generation, carry out parent selection, crossover, mutation, repair, survival selection on the population.

      • initAltRandom

        public void initAltRandom()
        Function to initialise layouts for the alternate mode: Random search. Creates a number of layouts comparable to those produced in a GA run.

      • LSAddOne

        public boolean LSAddOne()
        Common computational intelligence algorithm; local search add variant. The algorithm attempts to add a turbine to a random location, checking if it improves the fitness value. If it does, it places it. Otherwise the layout is considered finished.
        Returns:
        true if turbine added. False otherwise.

      • LSRemoveOne

        public boolean LSRemoveOne()
        Common computational intelligence algorithm; local search remove variant. The algorithm attempts to remove a turbine, checking if this improves the fitness value. If it does, it removes it. Otherwise the layout is considered finished.
        Returns:
        true if turbine removed. False otherwise.

      • moveOne

        public double[][] moveOne(double[][] layout,
                          int moveInd)
        Function used to move a turbine within a layout, i.e. for the move mutate operator. Moves a turbine by finding the X and Y distance using a Gaussian distribution. Attempts to move the turbine 100 times before 'giving up'.
        Parameters:
        layout - Layout to mutate
        moveInd - Index of the turbine to move
        Returns:
        a layout with one turbine moved

      • initRandom

        public double[][] initRandom()
        Create a layout with turbines placed randomly within. Randomly selects a maximum number of turbines to place (up to 1000). Attempts to add a turbine 500 times before 'giving up' and considering the layout full.
        Returns:
        A layout

      • initGridRnd

        public double[][] initGridRnd()
        Create a layout where turbines are dispersed semi-regularly with the minimum spacing requirement between them, plus an additional percentage of the field width/height. Default initialisation for GA.
        Returns:
        A layout

      • crossoverUniform

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> crossoverUniform(double[][] layout1,
                                                        double[][] layout2)
        Crossover variant 1, uniform crossover. While iterating through the smaller of the two parent layouts, has 50% chance to take that turbine and place it in a child layout. If it does not, turbine with same index in larger layout is placed in child layout. When smaller layout is complete, larger layout is iterated through, with 50% chance for each remaining turbine to be place in child. Second child is created by taking the turbines from both parents that were not used in first child.
        Parameters:
        layout1 -
        layout2 -
        Returns:
        Two child layouts

      • crossoverUniform2

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> crossoverUniform2(double[][] layout1,
                                                         double[][] layout2)
        Crossover variant 2, variable mixing ratio. While iterating through the smaller of the two parent layouts, has chance to take that turbine and place it in a child layout. If it does not, turbine with same index in larger layout is placed in child layout. Chance is derived from c2Prob parameter. When smaller layout is complete, larger layout is iterated through, with 50% chance for each remaining turbine to be place in child.
        Parameters:
        layout1 -
        layout2 -
        Returns:
        Two child layouts

      • crossoverUniform3

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> crossoverUniform3(double[][] layout1,
                                                         double[][] layout2)
        Crossover variant 3, percentage of parent. While iterating through the smaller of the two parent layouts, takes all turbines up to a percentage of the total layout size and places them in a child layout. When percentage is met, fill the child with the second parent's turbines. Percentage is derived from c3Perc parameter. Second child is created by mirroring the above child, i.e. first portion of child is filled by the second parent's turbines and second portion by the first's.
        Parameters:
        layout1 -
        layout2 -
        Returns:
        Two child layouts

      • repairLayoutS

        public double[][] repairLayoutS(double[][] layout)
        Simple repair function. Checks if layout is valid. If it is not, iterates through all turbines looking for those that are too close to other turbines and if they are, adds their index to a list. On completing the iterating, removes all turbines that appear in the 'offender' list.
        Parameters:
        layout -
        Returns:
        Repaired layout

      • repairLayoutA

        public double[][] repairLayoutA(double[][] layout)
        Advanced repair function. Checks if layout is valid. If not, iterates through all turbines looking for those that are too close to other turbines and if they are, adds their index to a list. If the turbine is too close to more than one other turbine, this is also noted. On completing the iterating, sorts the list of indices and numbers of violations and removes the most offending turbine. The layout is rechecked for validity and if it is still invalid, the next more offending turbine is removed, and so on.
        Parameters:
        layout -
        Returns:
        Repaired layout

      • repairAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> repairAll(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                                                 boolean adv)
        Function to repair the whole population. Iterates through individuals, repairing as necessary and according to the repair variant selected in settings.
        Parameters:
        pops -
        adv -
        Returns:
        A fully repaired population

      • selection

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> selection(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> fits)
        Survival selection function. Take the top half of all layouts (elitism) and allow them to progress to next generation.
        Parameters:
        pops -
        fits -
        Returns:
        List of layouts to survive to next generation

      • tournament

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> tournament(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> fits,
                                                  int tourSize)
        Parent selection function. Creates popNo/2 competitions of size 2 and populates these randomly from the population. The winner is the layout with a better fitness value and is permitted to be a parent and is added to the 'parents' list.
        Parameters:
        pops -
        fits -
        tourSize -
        Returns:
        List of layouts that will be parents for child layouts this generation

      • tournament2

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> tournament2(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> fits,
                                                   int tourSize)
        Alternative parent selection function. Creates popNo/2 competitions of size 2 and populates these randomly from the population. If a layout has fewer turbines and better fitness value, it is the winner. If it has fewer turbines and worse fitness value, it has a chance to be accepted as winner. The winner is permitted to be a parent and is added to the 'parents' list.
        Parameters:
        pops -
        fits -
        tourSize -
        Returns:
        List of layouts that will be parents for child layouts this generation

      • addChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> addChildren(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                                                   java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> children)
        Function to introduce children to the population.
        Parameters:
        pops -
        children -
        Returns:
        Full population

      • crossover

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> crossover(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> parents)
        Crossover genetic operator controller. Takes a list of parents and randomly selects from them to undergo crossover. Crossover variant depends on GA input settings.
        Parameters:
        parents -
        Returns:
        ArrayList of newly created child layouts

      • mutate

        public java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> mutate(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> children,
                                              double mutRateT,
                                              double mutRateL)
        Mutation genetic operator controller. Takes a list of children created this generation and passes them to the appropriate mutation variant. Mutation variant depends on GA input settings.
        Parameters:
        children -
        mutRateT -
        mutRateL -
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all children of this generation

      • mutAddS

        public double[][] mutAddS(double[][] layout)
        Simple variant of the mutation add operator. Attempts 500 times to add a turbine to a random location in the layout. If there is space, add the turbine and continue trying to add more. Otherwise, do not.
        Parameters:
        layout -
        Returns:
        potentially mutated child

      • mutAddA

        public double[][] mutAddA(double[][] layout)
        Advanced variant of the mutation add operator. Iterates across the layout in a grid-like fashion, checking at specific points to see if there is space for a turbine. If there are spaces, add turbines at these points. Otherwise, do not.
        Parameters:
        layout -
        Returns:
        potentially mutated child

      • evalGen

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> evalGen(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops)
        Evaluates all individuals in the current generation and updates the arraylist tracking fitness values
        Parameters:
        pops -
        Returns:

      • saveResults

        public void saveResults(java.util.ArrayList<double[][]> pops,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> fits)
        Save the fitness value and layout size for each individual. Run at end of each generation
        Parameters:
        pops -
        fits -
